hints.content:
We can think of $\purpleC{632}$ as $\purpleC{6\text{ hundreds}}$, $\purpleC{3\text{ tens}}$, and $\purpleC{2 \text{ ones}}$.  

We can think of $\blueD{75}$ as $\blueD{7\text{ tens}}$  and $\blueD{5\text{ ones}}$.

$\phantom{=}\purpleC{632}+\blueD{75}$

$=\purpleC{6\text{ hundreds}}+\purpleC{3\text{ tens}}+\purpleC{2\text{ ones}}+\blueD{7\text{ tens}}+\blueD{5\text{ ones}}$

$= \purpleC{6\text{ hundreds}}+\purpleC{3\text{ tens}}+\blueD{7\text{ tens}}+\purpleC{2\text{ ones}}+\blueD{5\text{ ones}}$
The answer: $ 6\text{ hundreds} + 3 \text{ tens}+7 \text{ tens}+2 \text{ ones}+5\text{ ones}$

question.content:
**What do we get when we break apart $632+75$ using place value?**
